title: TOP 10 SNOW REMOVAL MISTAKES TRACTOR OWNERS MAKE

tasks.task: The video discusses various snow removal mistakes tractor owners make, suggesting ways to avoid them. To perform physical tasks related to this, a person would need to handle and operate snow removal equipment, paying attention to safety and technique.
Attach a snow pusher to the tractor's loader.
subtasks: Carefully position the snow pusher onto the loader attachment.
Ensure the pusher is securely fastened to prevent movement during operation.

tasks.task: Drive the tractor onto the snow-covered drive for removal.
subtasks: Check for hidden obstacles before driving to prevent damage to the equipment or injury.
Drive slowly and carefully around edges and curves to avoid damaging the plow edge.

tasks.task: Operate the snow pusher to remove compacted snow from driveways or parking lots.
subtasks: Use the right edge material (UHMW or rubber) to minimize damage to surfaces.
Ensure the plow's trip spring mechanism is set appropriately based on the season (released in winter to avoid jarring stops).

tasks.task: Manage snow accumulation to avoid backing up against property lines.
subtasks: Distribute the plowed snow to a designated area to prevent backups near property lines or structures.
Use a combination of plowing and pushing to efficiently move snow over long distances.

tasks.task: Check and maintain traction during snow removal.
subtasks: Evaluate tire tread patterns and suitability for snowy conditions.
Apply ballast or wheel weights to increase equipment stability and traction, avoiding skidding or spinning.

tasks.task: Prepare the tractor for winter operation.
subtasks: Check and add anti-gel treatment to diesel fuel for colder temperatures.
Inspect and replace any necessary battery tenders or trickle chargers to ensure reliable starting in low temperatures.

tasks.task: Check and replace faulty lights and bulbs for nighttime snow removal.
subtasks: Test all lights (headlights, work lights, etc.) for visibility and functionality.
Install LED bulbs for improved clarity and longevity in lighting systems.

tasks.task: Implement safe practices when using tractor-mounted plows, such as using lights and caution signs when on public roads.
subtasks: Activate flashing lights and ensure all exterior lights are operational before operation.
Use cones or signs to alert pedestrians and other vehicles to the presence of moving equipment.
